lead_paragraph: Cesar Vargas, who came to United States illegally as a child, was sworn in as a member of the New York State Bar after years of legal obstacles.

headline.print_headline: An Immigrant’s Four-Year Fight to Become a Lawyer Ends in Celebrations
headline.main: An Immigrant’s Four-Year Fight to Become a Lawyer Ends in Celebrations

snippet: Cesar Vargas, who came to United States illegally as a child, was sworn in as a member of the New York State Bar after years of legal obstacles.
abstract: Cesar Vargas, 32-year-old Mexican immigrant who does not have legal status, is sworn in as member of New York State Bar in Brooklyn, ending four-year legal fight to become lawyer; State Supreme Court appellate panel voted unanimously in June to grant his bar application, making Vargas first immigrant without legal status allowed entry into bar;  immigration activists view Vargas's success in case as reason for renewed hope.
